page.title: 02GREAT WITLEY PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Church of{St.Michael and All {Angels}at Great Witley is well known as the finest example of an Italianate {baroque church}in this country. The rather plain Georgian church of {1735}was transformed into its present magnificance by the second{Baron {Foley}when,in 1747 he acquired the windows,paintings and other fittings from the chapel of the great house at {Canons,}Little Stanmore near Edgeware, Middlesex.The beautiful ceiling paintings are the work of{Antonio {Bellucci}The white marble font showing three angels in marble with an oak cover surmounted by a carving of St. John the Baptist,is the work of{James {Forsyth,}and the mosaic reredos given by Rachel,Countess of Dudley is the work of{Salviati of Venice.}The South transept is dominated by{Rysbrach's monument to the 1st Lord & Lady Foley.
